004
005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007/**
008 * NetworkTables event.
009 *
010 * <p>Events have flags. The flags are a bitmask and must be OR'ed together when listening to an
011 * event to indicate the combination of events desired to be received.
012 */
013@SuppressWarnings("MemberName")
014public final class NetworkTableEvent {
015  /** No flags. */
016  public static final int kNone = 0;
017
018  /**
019   * Initial listener addition. Set this flag to receive immediate notification of matches to the
020   * flag criteria.
021   */
022  public static final int kImmediate = 0x01;
023
024  /** Client connected (on server, any client connected). */
025  public static final int kConnected = 0x02;
026
027  /** Client disconnected (on server, any client disconnected). */
028  public static final int kDisconnected = 0x04;
029
030  /** Any connection event (connect or disconnect). */
031  public static final int kConnection = kConnected | kDisconnected;
032
033  /** New topic published. */
034  public static final int kPublish = 0x08;
035
036  /** Topic unpublished. */
037  public static final int kUnpublish = 0x10;
038
039  /** Topic properties changed. */
040  public static final int kProperties = 0x20;
041
042  /** Any topic event (publish, unpublish, or properties changed). */
043  public static final int kTopic = kPublish | kUnpublish | kProperties;
044
045  /** Topic value updated (via network). */
046  public static final int kValueRemote = 0x40;
047
048  /** Topic value updated (local). */
049  public static final int kValueLocal = 0x80;
050
051  /** Topic value updated (network or local). */
052  public static final int kValueAll = kValueRemote | kValueLocal;
053
054  /** Log message. */
055  public static final int kLogMessage = 0x100;
056
057  /**
058   * Handle of listener that was triggered. The value returned when adding the listener can be used
059   * to map this to a specific added listener.
060   */
061  public final int listener;
062
063  /**
064   * Event flags. For example, kPublish if the topic was not previously published. Also indicates
065   * the data included with the event:
066   *
067   * <ul>
068   *   <li>kConnected or kDisconnected: connInfo
069   *   <li>kPublish, kUnpublish, or kProperties: topicInfo
070   *   <li>kValueRemote, kValueLocal: valueData
071   *   <li>kLogMessage: logMessage
072   * </ul>
073   */
074  public final int flags;
075
076  /** Connection information (for connection events). */
077  public final ConnectionInfo connInfo;
078
079  /** Topic information (for topic events). */
080  public final TopicInfo topicInfo;
081
082  /** Value data (for value events). */
083  public final ValueEventData valueData;
084
085  /** Log message (for log message events). */
086  public final LogMessage logMessage;
087
088  /**
089   * Constructor. This should generally only be used internally to NetworkTables.
090   *
091   * @param inst Instance
092   * @param listener Listener that was triggered
093   * @param flags Event flags
094   * @param connInfo Connection information
095   * @param topicInfo Topic information
096   * @param valueData Value data
097   * @param logMessage Log message
098   */
099  public NetworkTableEvent(
100      NetworkTableInstance inst,
101      int listener,
102      int flags,
103      ConnectionInfo connInfo,
104      TopicInfo topicInfo,
105      ValueEventData valueData,
106      LogMessage logMessage) {
107    this.m_inst = inst;
108    this.listener = listener;
109    this.flags = flags;
110    this.connInfo = connInfo;
111    this.topicInfo = topicInfo;
112    this.valueData = valueData;
113    this.logMessage = logMessage;
114  }
115
116  /* Network table instance. */
117  private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
118
119  /**
120   * Gets the instance associated with this event.
121   *
122   * @return Instance
123   */
124  public NetworkTableInstance getInstance() {
125    return m_inst;
126  }
127}
